intro: Galium × schiedeanum, commonly known as the silverweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, spreading stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its roots are fibrous and can form dense mats, allowing it to thrive in moist, shaded environments. Galium × schiedeanum is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
